TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {386=Personal Bests: 100 – 11.0 (1912); 400 – 49.9 (1912); PV – 3.60 (11-9¾) (1912); LJ – 7.28 (23-10¾) (1912); Dec – 5825 (1912)., 2722=Full name: Eugene Leroy "Roy" Mercer Gender: Male Height: 5-10.5 (180 cm) Weight: 176 lbs (80 kg) Born: October 30, 1888 in Kennett Square, Pennsylvania, United States Died: July 2, 1957 Affiliations: Penn Quakers, Philadelphia (USA) Country:  United States Sport: Athletics, 741=Roy Mercer competed in track for Penn, but was better known as a football player for the Quakers. He was elected to the College Football Hall of Fame in 1955. He graduated from Penn with an MD degree, but later became Dean of the department of physical education at Penn. At the 1912 Olympics, he also competed in the baseball demonstration event.}
